intro: Conosapium madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical lowland forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a notable species in the biodiversity of Madagascar.
